According to Moore's Law, named for a founder of Intel, these double in power roughly every 18 months
Dan Bricklin developed VISICALC, the first of these programs, similar to an accounting ledger
Coherent & Xenix are 2 of these, part of the abbreviation in the better-known MS-DOS
This programming language was named for calculating-machine inventor Blaise
Among Internet users, the World Wide Web has surpassed the system named for this burrowing rodent
Paris Silverskins are the small ones of these used in Gibson cocktails
Yes, they were named after the capital of Peru
In Asian cuisine, sprouts are from beans & shoots are usually from this
The Dutch type of this is white, as it's grown underground; the American is green, as the spears are grown above
Antoine-Auguste Parmentier pushed this tuber on Louis XVI; now Parmentier in a recipe means "with" it

4 English Channel lighthouses have been built on the Eddystone Rocks, famed cause of these disasters
The Cinque Ports, an 11th century confederation, were Sandwich, Dover, Hythe, Romney & this 1066 battle site
These air-cushion vehicles that were "full of eels" in a Monty Python sketch first crossed the Channel in 1959
Victor Hugo lived for 15 years on this Channel Island, the largest after Jersey
On Aug. 19, 1942 an Allied force took heavy casualties in an attack on this fort fortified by Germans

rounds.comments: (Alex: Example: Canterbury Tales author who rhymes with a dish: Chaucer (Saucer).)

clues.text: 19th century lord whose last name rhymes with deer meat
Irish poet who rhymes with wooden boxes for packing
Ode-acious poet who rhymes with red root vegetables
"Gunga Din" author who rhymes with habitual drinking
New Englander who rhymes with a price or sacrifice
At the 1988 Democratic Convention he said, "We are all precious in God's sight--the real Rainbow Coalition"
Advice from this American author:  "When angry, count four; when very angry, swear"
In 1939 Churchill said the action of Russia "is a riddle wrapped in a mystery inside" this
This innovative American director said, "Everybody denies I am a genius--but nobody ever called me one!"
In "The Power of Myth" he says, "Follow your bliss"
El Espectador & El Tiempo, the 2 largest of Colombia's daily newspapers, are published in this city
The Putomayo, a branch of this river, forms much of Colombia's border with Peru
Colombia's coat of arms was adopted in 1834 & features this vulture perched on top
Colombia's second-largest city, it's known for its textiles & as a center for the illegal drug trade
In 1982 this Colombian who led Latin America's literary boom of the '60s won the Nobel Prize for Literature

"Some day we'll meeet again and
Away to his castle we'll go
To be happy forever I know"

"My reign will be a super-awesome thing
Oh, I just can't wait to be king"
"Have you ever heard the wolf cry to the blue corn moon, or asked the grinning bobcat why he grinned?"

Les poissons

To serve little fish"

The FBI's HRT, a "Rescue Team" for these, can be anywhere in 4 hours
On Feb. 6, 1938 the lifesavers of Bondi Beach in this country rescued 300 people from freak waves
When sent down, the rescue capsule for the Quecreek miners in this state carried water, Skoal & Hershey bars
If you're rescued from a deep-sea dive, you may go into this type of chamber, from the same root as "barometer"
An old infantry weapon, or the type of "pole" used to tear down walls
Getting the role of Colonel Potter on "M*A*S*H" was a bit of a demotion; he'd previosuly played a general on the show
Gary "Big Hands" Johnson played defense for 10 seasons with this NFL team, the southernmost in California
Bigfoot went domestic in this 1987 comedy with John Lithgow
Here's a Harry & a Gary: in 1995 this "Forrest Gump" actor played Harry Truman
Harry Shearer has voiced at least 36 different characters, including Jebediah Springfield, on this show
This legendary magician was imprisoned in a thorn bush by a "watery" woman using magic he had taught her
He disappeared after just 3 weeks at Fordham; years later, he'd make the Statue of Liberty follow suit
This magician does the ultimate disappearing act & ends up on an enchanted island with Ariel & the brutish Caliban
Don't feel ripped off if you pay to see these 2 magicians at the Rio in Vegas & only one of them ever speaks
Martin Luther believed this German magician & astrologer, a Goethe subject, had devilish powers

rounds.text: Halls of fame into which she's been inducted include the California, National Women's, National Aviation & U.S. Astronaut
